radiographic_examinations.findings: The transplanted kidney measures 11.7 cm with stable mild hydronephrosis. There is a small amount of perinephric fluid; ascites is present in all four quadrants. Thickening of the bladder wall is unchanged. Doppler examination demonstrates normal arterial and venous waveforms in the main renal artery and vein.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Resistive indices within the upper, mid, and lower poles are 0.78, 0.83, and 0.79 respectively, which are elevated and increased compared to the prior exam.
